Sun, 10 Nov 2024 16:00:00 +0000 Te Ngare Te Ake Ake, pictured on the morning of trial before guilty pleas were entered, has been sent to prison after holding his ex at his rural property and assaulting her over two days.

Weather: MetService reveals the hottest towns this weekend, and what weather is in store next week https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/weather-metservice-reveals-the-hottest-towns-this-weekend-and-what-weather-is-in-store-next-week/AMXN2F4H65HRTAPD7VL3OXXAPQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/weather-metservice-reveals-the-hottest-towns-this-weekend-and-what-weather-is-in-store-next-week/AMXN2F4H65HRTAPD7VL3OXXAPQ/ MetService said midweek looks settled, with light winds and mostly clear skies. Sun, 10 Nov 2024 16:00:00 +0000 The Waiho River in Westland at 8am today November 11 2024. The river was at 8.2m around 9am and rising, with the peak expected late morning. A local state of emergency has been declared in the southern ward of Westland District as flooding causes evacuations, road closures and slips. Photo / West Coast Regional Council Facebook https://www.facebook.com/photo/?fbid=966628192158344&set=a.308399864647850
Hundreds of police staff criminally investigated since 2021 https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/hundreds-of-police-staff-criminally-investigated-since-2021/NU5AXWELZVBEZGDBQFSZWO2M4A/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/hundreds-of-police-staff-criminally-investigated-since-2021/NU5AXWELZVBEZGDBQFSZWO2M4A/ Jaime CunninghamAlmost 40% had been employed for more than 10 years.Sun, 10 Nov 2024 16:00:00 +0000 Police told the Herald about 1% of their workforce have been investigated since 2021.
